intro: Tarenna guelcheriana var. henningsiana, commonly known as the Hennings' tarenna, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its slender, climbing habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink, followed by small, yellowish fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
